alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:57AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN SUSSEX...WARREN...NORTHERN LEHIGH...CARBON...SOUTHERN MONROE AND NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 255 AM EST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from Millbrook to near McMichael to Weatherly. Movement was south at 25 mph. Wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph are possible with this squall, with snow reducing visibility to less than one mile. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Lehighton, Bethlehem, Forks, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Hackettstown, Wilson, Washington, Blairstown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Jim Thorpe, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Nesquehoning, Wind Gap and Bath. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 59 and 89. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 72 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 304 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 17. Visibilities may drop quickly to near one mile in this squall. Use caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Quick changes in visibility and slick roads can lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
